title: Ahmed Rebai
text:
Ahmed Rebai (in <a href="Arabic">Arabic</a>  : أحمد الرباعي, <a href="International%20Phonetic%20Alphabet">"[amɛd ʁebai]" ?</a>), by his full name Ahmed Ben Wajdi Rebai (أحمد بن وجدي الرباعي), born on October 27, 1997 in <a href="Tunisia">Tunis</a>, is a Tunisian
singer.
Coming from a family of musicians from <a href="Sfax">Sfax</a>, he is the nephew of singer <a href="Saber%20Reba%C3%AF">Saber Rebaï</a>.
Biography.
Childhood and training.
Ahmed Rebai, born in 1997 in Tunis into a family of musicians, with his father Wajdi, a professional musician, and his uncle Saber, a renowned singer. His father realizes that his son has talent and that he must be supported in his first steps and especially help him develop his career. Very early on, he encouraged him to learn music and play the <a href="violin">violin</a> in specialized schools, such as the National Conservatory of Music in Tunis. Ahmed Rebai started singing at the age of eleven.
After obtaining his baccalaureate, he followed university studies at the Higher Institute of Music of Tunis, where he obtained a fundamental license in music and <a href="musicology">musicology</a> in 2019. In 2020, it follows studies master.
